tu.tuid: com.percussion.cx.PSFolderSecurityPanel@Are you sure you want to limit access for yourself?

tu.note: Warn users when the folder ACL entry list is empty and hence the anybody may be able to modify the folder.

Illegal context to run the effect. First parameter is the name of the effect and the second one is the list of contexts valid for this effect to run

tu.note: The current relationship is not promotable and is being ignored. First parameter is name of the effect and the second one is the relationship name

tuv.seg: Current relationship <{1}> is not promotable in the effect <{0} and is ignored.

tu.note: Workflowid in the request is null while processing the effect and is ignored. The parameter required for this message is the name of the effect.

tuv.seg: The workflowid required to process the effect <{0}> is null and hence the effect is not processed.

tu.note: Invalid workflow action to run this effect. The first parameter required for this message is the name of the effect and the second one is the name of the workflow action.

tuv.seg: The workflow action <{1}> is invalid for the effect <{0}> to run and is ignored.

tu.note: Current content item is not in public state hence this effect will not run

tuv.seg: Current item is not in a public state and hence the effect <{0}> will be ignored.

tu.note: This effect is triggered by itself and is ignored

tuv.seg: This effect <{0}> is triggered by itself and is ignored.

tu.note: Invalid force transition option for the effect it must be 'yes' or 'no'.

tuv.seg: Invalid force transition <{1}> option for the effect <{0}>. It must be either 'yes' or 'no'. Processing will not continue.

tu.note: Invalid transition for this effect to and hence is ignored.

tuv.seg: The effect <{0}> will run only when the main item is transitioning from a <{1}> state to a <{2}> and hence is ignored.

tu.note: Rhythmyx resource required for the internal request is missing

tuv.seg: The Rhythmyx resource <{1}> required for internal request is missing for the effect <{0}> to run.

tu.note: A dependent item (may be the owner or dependent) is not in a desired state to run the effect

tuv.seg: The <{0}> Effect did not succeed, because the dependent item with contentid: <{1}> is not in a desired state: <{2}> and the <force transition> option is not set to <yes>.

tu.note: A dependent item (may be the owner or dependent) is not in a state from where it can go to a desired

tuv.seg: A dependent item cannot go to a <{1}> state from current state and the effect <{0}> is not processed.

tu.note: Unimplemented operation. This problem is raised if an operation is executed that is not implemented in the server's current mode.

tuv.seg: An unimplemented search operation has been attempted.

tu.note: Specified object not found. This can occur from a number of different methods, so the message needs to be somewhat generic. A more specific error should be generated where possible.

tuv.seg: The search engine object ''{0}'' was not found.

tu.note: The search terms for the query are missing.

tuv.seg: The search terms for the query are missing.

tu.note: Some horrible, nasty fatal error occurred.

tuv.seg: A fatal error occurred in the search subsystem.

tu.note: Bad or missing parameters were passed to a method

tuv.seg: Bad or missing parameters were passed to a method

tu.note: The search engine had remaining wildcards when the limit, specified by MAX_REG_EXPR_PROPERTY was reached.

tuv.seg: The wildcard limit was reached with wildcards left to expand in the search.

tu.note: The search engine hit an error that wasn't mapped. Ask the user to call tech support so we can augment the mapping list.

tuv.seg: The search system implementation hit an error that was not mapped to a specific error for user display. Please contact technical support about error code ''{0}'' which was returned by the search system implementation from ''{1}''.

tu.note: The query string had one or more parsing errors. Note that the passed description is in English, although they are quite short and consist of messages like "missing parent".

tuv.seg: The query string contained one or more parsing problems. The search subsystem ''{0}'' returned the specific parse error ''{1}''.

tu.note: If any objects allocated from the search engine have not been released before shutdown is called, this exception will be thrown.

tu.note: If a search request is made that requires the search engine but one is not configured or enabled, this exception will be thrown.

tuv.seg: The search request submitted to the server requires an external search engine to be configured and enabled.

tu.note: If an index event is processed for an item whose content type is not currently valid for indexing, this exception will be thrown.

The Copy Site wizard dialog title.
Instruction for the Copy Site wizard start page.

tuv.seg:
This wizard will guide you through the process of copying an existing Site.
Press the Next button to start the process.

tu.note: Instruction for the Copy Site wizard name page.

tuv.seg: Enter a name for the new Site Folder, select the Site to be copied and provide a new Site name. The Site Folder name must be unique within the target Folder (the Folder from where you started the 'Paste As' action) while the Site name must be unique among all existing Sites.

tu.tuid: com.percussion.cx.PSActionManager@Copy Site Copy Options Page Instruction
tu.note: Instruction for the Copy Site wizard copy options page.

tuv.seg: Specify whether you want to copy the Site without content, with navigational content only or with all content.

tu.tuid: com.percussion.cx.PSActionManager@Copy Site Content Copy Options Page Instruction
tu.note: Instruction for the Copy Site wizard copy content options page.

tuv.seg: Specify whether you want to copy non-navigational content as link or as new copy.

tu.tuid: com.percussion.cx.PSActionManager@Copy Site Community Mapping Page Instruction
tu.note: Instruction for the Copy Site wizard community mappings page.

tuv.seg: By default, the new copies of your Folders and Content Items are created in the same Community as the originals. If you want to create the new Folders and Content Items in a different Community, change the value in the Target Community column to the name of that Community.

tu.note: Instruction for the Copy Site wizard finish page.

tuv.seg: You have selected to copy the source Site with the following options:

tu.note: Error message for the Copy Site Name page for the case no site name was supplied.

tuv.seg: You must provide a valid name for the new Site.

tu.note: Error message for the Copy Site Name page for the case an invalid site name was supplied.

tuv.seg: The supplied Site name is invalid. The Site name must be unique among all existing Sites

tu.note: Error message for the Copy Site Name page for the case no site folder name was supplied.

tuv.seg: You must provide a valid name for the new Site Folder.

tu.note: Error message for the Copy Site Name page for the case an invalid site folder name was supplied.

tuv.seg: The supplied Site Folder name is invalid. The Site Folder name must be unique within the target Folder.

tu.note: Error message for the Copy Site Subfolder Name page for the case no site subfolder name was supplied.

tuv.seg: You must provide a valid name for the new Site Subfolder.

tu.note: Error message for the Copy Site Subfolder Name page for the case an invalid site subfolder name was supplied.

tuv.seg: The supplied Site Subfolder name is invalid. The Site Subfolder name must be unique within the target Folder.

tu.tuid: com.percussion.cx.wizards.PSCopySiteSubfolderNamePage@Site Subfolder name has too many characters.
tu.note: Error message for the Copy Site Subfolder Name page for the case a supplied site subfolder name was too long.

tuv.seg: The supplied Site Subfolder name has too many characters. The Site Subfolder name cannot be more than 100 characters in length.

tu.note: The Copy Site Subfolder wizard dialog title.

tu.tuid: com.percussion.cx.PSActionManager@Copy Site Subfolder Start Page Instruction
tu.note: Instruction for the Copy Site Subfolder wizard start page.

tuv.seg:
This wizard will guide you through the process of copying a Site Subfolder.
Press the Next button to start the process.

tu.tuid: com.percussion.cx.PSActionManager@Copy Site Subfolder Name Page Instruction
tu.note: Instruction for the Copy Site Subfolder wizard name page.

tuv.seg: Enter a name for the new Site Subfolder. The new Subfolder name must be unique within the target Folder (the Folder from where you started the 'Paste As' action).

tu.tuid: com.percussion.cx.PSActionManager@Copy Site Subfolder Copy Options Page Instruction
tu.note: Instruction for the Copy Site Subfolder wizard copy options page.

tuv.seg: Specify whether you want to copy the Site Subfolder with or without content.

tu.tuid: com.percussion.cx.PSActionManager@Copy Site Subfolder Content Copy Options Page Instruction
tu.note: Instruction for the Copy Site Subfolder wizard copy content options page.

tuv.seg: Specify whether you want to copy non-navigational content as link or as new copy.

tu.tuid: com.percussion.cx.PSActionManager@Copy Site Subfolder Community Mapping Page Instruction
tu.note: Instruction for the Copy Site Subfolder wizard community mappings page.

tuv.seg: By default, the new copies of your Folders and Content Items are created in the same Community as the originals. If you want to create the new Folders and Content Items in a different Community, change the value in the Target Community column to the name of that Community.

tu.tuid: com.percussion.cx.PSActionManager@Copy Site Subfolder Finish Page Instruction
tu.note: Instruction for the Copy Site Subfolder wizard finish page.

tuv.seg: You have selected to copy the source Site Subfolder with the following options:

tu.note: Warning message part 1

tuv.seg: Warning: This version of Percussion has not been tested with the version of the Web Browser that you are currently using, as a result you may or may not experience unexpected behaviors in the user interface.

tu.note: Warning message part 2

tuv.seg: By clicking "I agree", you accept that problems may occur if you use a non-certified browser. You may be prompted to re-enter your username and password.
